thread.title: Night begins and ends badly for Greenbrier
thread.title_full: Night begins and ends badly for Greenbrier

author: MEREDITH SCOTT
title: Night begins and ends badly for Greenbrier
text:
Night begins and ends badly for Greenbrier   9:25pm By MEREDITH SCOTT LOG CABIN CORRESPONDENT 
GREENBRIER — Friday night was supposed to be the night Greenbrier bounced back from a heartbreaking loss last week to Little Rock Christian. 
However, one interception (a 43-yard pick-6), one fumble and six fourth-down turnovers, resulted in a 35-0 thumping to the Goblins at Don Jones Stadium. 
The loss thrust Greenbrier back into a logjam behind Little Rock Christian in the 5A-West race. Greenbrier and Harrison are both 4-4, 3-2, with two games left. 
If Greenbrier’s first drive was a sign of how the game would go, it was clear the Panthers would have a struggle. 
Greenbrier’s defense was able to hold the Goblins’ run game, forcing Harrison to end their first drive with a punt. A dropped fair catch from Carter Burcham put the ball right back into Harrison’s hands at the Panthers’ 43 leading to a touchdown. 
The Panthers had an opportunity for a touchdown when Harold Ross connected with Brandon Thomas midfield or a 76-yard touchdown pass, but an unsportsmanlike penalty at Harrison’s 40 wiped the points off the board. 
Greenbrier ended the third quarter with a fourth-down turnover with an incomplete pass from Burcham. A 70-yard interception return by Kanon Kirkland put the mercy rule in effect the fourth quarter as the Goblins took a 35-0 lead. 
Noah Ditmanson rushed for 150 yards and a touchdown for Harrison. 
Next week, Greenbrier will travel to Clarksville before closing out the regular season at Vilonia.
